summary.body: The Neighbourhood Policing Team has been asked to remind BarbicanTalk members that advice on how to lessen the impact of the current heatwave can be found at   or by phoning nhs direct on Tel: 0845 4647 We would also ask, if your neighbour is elderly or infirm, that you just check on them during this time. Although stormy weather is forecast, the temperature is forecast to remain 'high'. If you are worried about the lack of response from a neighbour's premises, please contact the City Police switchboard (020 7601 2222) as soon as possible. Yours
summary.subject: Current Heatwave

summary.body: Hi Paul/John I wanted to know the Police's view on a car being driven to an MOT Testing Station, if there is a pre-booked appointment, and the old MOT has run out. I've been told anecdotally that it's fine, but I wanted to know if I would need to get it trailered over... I don't want to leave my MOT to run out and then fall foul of the law! Many thanks Tim
summary.subject: Car legality - a query!

summary.body: I'd love to say it's a heatwave, but it's not...... Friday 20/07/2007 "The risk of disruption across the London area is assessed as 60%.  20-30mm of rain looks likely, generally over much of the area in the 36 hours up to midday Saturday.   60-90mm is possible in some areas although, as the warning indicates, there is some doubt about where the highest amounts of rainfall will occur.  At this stage, parts of London must be considered to be in the firing line for some of these higher totals.  With regard to timings, the rain currently looks likely to reach London in the early hours of Friday but it could be Friday evening before the heaviest rain clears northwards.  Thereafter, there is a risk of further outbreaks of rain as another band moves back across the region during the day on Saturday.     There are considerable doubts about the detail of this though.   " Should anyone notice signs of Summer, please contact Barbicantalk immediately.
summary.subject: Severe Weather Friday 20/07

summary.body: Drug, Alcohol and Internet Safety Event  City of London Drug Action Team With parenting, family and social issues such us drug awareness and internet safety at the front of our minds more and more, the Drug Action Team will be hosting two events for parents to attend - offering practical, useful advice on the issues that really matter, please come along and share your concerns with people who care & understand. 1st event Golden Lane Community Centre (Opposite Great Arthur House - Tower Block) Golden Lane Date and time: Tuesday 9th October at 6.30 pm 2nd event Middlesex Street Community Hall Middlesex Street Estate Date and time: Tuesday 17th October at 6.30 pm Both events will feature discussions & questions and will be friendly and informal
